description.narrative: Background of the assignment The Government of Sweden implements its cooperation policy through development cooperation strategy with Burkina Faso for the period 2018-2022. The purpose is to contribute to greater respect for human rights, institutional capacity growth, increased resilience to crises and disasters, environmentally and climate-resilient sustainable development, and improved opportunities for sustainable livelihoods. Two of the eight expected results of the strategy period are directly related to sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR): • Strengthen respect for human rights, especially for women and girls, and increased opportunities for vulnerable people to enjoy their rights and • Improved access to basic public services and social security Furthermore, the strategy states that Sweden will contribute to increased implementation of sexual and reproductive health and rights. Preventive measures concerning gender-based violence and female genital mutilation should also be included. Synergies should be sought with other Swedish strategies. In 2018, the Embassy of Sweden in Ouagadougou (EoS) through its framework agreement with KIT Royal Tropical Institute of the Netherlands, conducted a mapping of SRHR challenges, partners and donors working with sexual and reproductive health and rights in Burkina Faso. Three years later, following the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the changing socio-political environment, the EoS wishes to update the SRHR mapping in order to take into account potentially new actors and partnerships and other recent dynamics and developments related to SRHR. 2. Aim and objectives The aim of the assignment is to provide the EoS in Ouagadougou with an update of the mapping of SRHR in Burkina Faso, taking the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic and the current conflict situation into consideration. Specific objectives are to provide sufficient information on the following aspects to allow the EoS to decide the most efficient use of its resources: a) The main SRHR challenges in the country. The consultants are expected to use the definition of SRHR published on page 10 of the Lancet-Guttmacher Commission on SRHR. Special attention should be paid to access to safe abortion, adolescents and young people, comprehensive sexuality education, sexual and gender-based violence, safe abortion and young peoples SRHR and also CSE and female genital mutilation. b) The key partners and partnerships (INGOs, multilateral agencies, local civil society) already working with SRHR in the country, justification for why they are considered relevant (networks, financial capacity, evidence-based) and also include regional initiatives in West Africa. c) The other donors funding SRHR, including U.S-, EU- and U.K.-based foundations. Include what they are funding and (if possible) the amounts and length of time of funding. Be aware that some donors (like FCDO) may be funding regional SRHR programs that include Burkina Faso although they do not have missions in-country. d) The perceived gaps in programming and financing from the perspective of the government, civil society and other donors. 2 e) Recommendations for programming to SRHR based on gaps and opportunities with proposed key target groups. Swedens added value in relation to the above should be assessed. Potential synergies with contributions funded by strategies such as the regional strategy for SRHR in sub-Saharan Africa 2016- 2021, the strategy for Sweden's development cooperation for global gender quality and women's and girls' rights 20182022 and the strategy for Sweden's global development cooperation in sustainable social development 20182022 should be included in the assessment. 3. Methods The consultants should suggest the best methods for realizing the assessment and the budget needed to through a call-off response. A field visit by the consultants to Ouagadougou is highly recommended. The report should be accompanied by spreadsheets with information on partners and donors. 4. Editing guidelines • Length: maximum 15 pages, excluding references and annexes (i.e. summary tables) • Language: English (USA) Reference- Harvard style • Text: Times New Roman • Font: 11 or 12 • Numbers: spell out single-digit whole numbers • Use numerals for numbers greater than nine • Acronyms: First time a word is used it should be spelled out followed by the corresponding acronym in parentheses. • List of acronyms provided in the beginning • References for written and oral sources along the lines of the Harvard system • List of references at the end of the document • Appendix if necessary (for example for spreadsheets) 5. Timeline and plan An example of timeline may be found below based on an assignment of 10 days during the time period of November-December 2021. The timeline will be further discussed with the consultants. Time plan and expected deliverables: 1) Inception meeting prior to arrival in Ouagadougou 2) Draft report to the Embassy during week 47 of November 3) Comments from the Embassy during week 48 4) Comments from the Embassy during week 50 5) Final document to the Embassy during week 51 6. Competencies The consultant should have the following competencies: a) Minimum Masters degree in social sciences or public health b) Minimum of three years of experience from development cooperation work in sub-Saharan Africa c) Good knowledge of SRHR issues d) Excellent communication skills e) Excellent written and spoken English f) Excellent written and spoken French g) Ability to summarize large amount of data into summarizing text h) Good knowledge and understanding of development cooperation principles 3 The consultant will preferably have experience in SRHR in Burkina Faso and/or West Africa. Additional advantage is experience in working with gender equality. 7. Details of on what Sida bases its decision on 1. The call-off response shall contain a proposed methodology, work plan, CV of proposed consultant and a budget for conducting the assignment. 2. Other information relevant for the assignment.

Syftet med insatsen är att ge Sveriges ambassad i Ouagadougou en uppdatering av kartläggningen av SRHR i Burkina Faso, med hänsyn till effekterna av Covid-19- pandemin och den nuvarande konfliktsituationen. Denna kartläggning ska vara en del av anslagsstödet till SRHR (Sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter) Burkina Faso, bidrag 15168. Specifika mål är att tillhandahålla tillräcklig information om följande aspekter för att Sveriges ambassad ska kunna besluta om den mest effektiva användningen av sina resurser: – De främsta SRHR-utmaningarna i landet. Konsulterna förväntas använda definitionen av SRHR publicerad på sidan 10 av Lancet-Guttmacher Commission on SRHR. Särskild uppmärksamhet bör ägnas åt tillgång till säker abort, ungdomar och unga människor, omfattande sexualundervisning, sexuellt och könsbaserat våld, säker abort och unga människors SRHR och även sexuell exploatering av barn (Child Sexual Exploitation, CSE) och kvinnlig könsstympning. - De nyckelpartner och partnerskap (INGOs, multilaterala organisationer, det lokala civila samhället) som redan arbetar med SRHR i landet, motivering till varför de anses relevanta (nätverk, finansiell kapacitet, evidensbaserad) och inkluderar även regionala initiativ i Västafrika. - De andra givarna som finansierar SRHR, inklusive USA-, EU- och U.K.-baserade stiftelser. Inkludera vad de finansierar och (om möjligt) beloppen och finansieringstiden. Var medveten om att vissa givare (som Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO)) kan finansiera regionala SRHR-program som inkluderar Burkina Faso även om de inte har uppdrag i landet. - De upplevda gapen i programmering och finansiering ur regeringens, civilsamhällets och andra givares perspektiv. Rekommendationer för programmering till SRHR baserat på gap och möjligheter med föreslagna nyckelmålgrupper. Sveriges mervärde i förhållande till ovanstående bör bedömas. Potentiella synergier med bidrag finansierade av strategier som den regionala Strategi för sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter (SRHR) i Afrika söder om Sahara 2015-2019 , strategi för Sveriges utvecklingssamarbete för global jämställdhet och kvinnors och flickors rättigheter 2018–2022 samt strategin Sveriges globala utvecklingssamarbete inom hållbar social utveckling 2018–2022 bör ingå i bedömningen
